newsitem.title: UK: UK money supply shows British economy buoyant.
newsitem.headline: UK money supply shows British economy buoyant.

text.p: Strong British money supply growth in September added to evidence that the economy was buoyant and gave more ammunition to Bank of England Governor Eddie George in his aim to raise interest rates, economists said on Friday,
Britain's M4 broad money supply growth climbed to 9.8 percent in September, the Bank of England said, stubbornly sticking above the government's target range of three-to-nine percent.
"It's another indicator that the economy is picking up," said Deutsche Morgan Grenfell economist Ciaran Barr. "M4 money supply continues to support Eddie George's case for an interest rate rise."
The figures also showed bank and building society lending grew somewhat less than expected, rising by 3.5 billion sterling ($5.6 billion) in September. ($1=.6299 Sterling)
